bioghist.p: George R. Allen (1919-1998) was the long-time president of William H. Allen, Bookseller, Philadelphia specialists in rare books. He graduated from Haverford College in 1940. He served as a staff sergeant in the Army during World War II and was the first member of American military intelligence to enter Adolf Hitler's hideout at Berchtesgaden. Some of the records and notes he uncovered there served as the basis for a 1950 book edited by Felix Gilbert entitled Hitler Directs His War. Allen published several books, including El Greco: Two Studies, History of William H. Allen Bookseller, 1918-1997, and The Strange Story of Moe Berg, Athlete, Scholar, Spy.

scopecontent.p: This collection of materials relates to Hitler and the Nazi propaganda campaign during World War II. There are photographs, medals/insignias, armbands, and German newspapers from 1944 and 1945. There are also newsprint propaganda leaflets and broadsides of Nazi, Soviet, and American origin. The collection also includes currency from many countries in Europe, Africa, and the Pacific. Materials are in German, Russian, and English.
